edmx:DataServices.Schema:
# Definition Key that you use to describe a handling unit. This key describes the height of the handling unit and the area where handling units with this type are stored. # Use You can assign all standard pallets (DB, JEP, disposable pallets) that are not packed to a height greater than 1m to the same type, and therefore to the same key (E1). # Dependencies The HU type of the packaging materials is taken as a default value when building a handling unit. You can change this value at a later time. # Example
# Definition Specifies the total of the tare weight of the handling unit and its loading weight. # Example Your packaging material has a gross weight of 0.5 kg and a 'maximum weight' of 2 kg. You pack product 'spark plugs' in the packaging material. The maximum number of spark plugs you can pack in the packaging material is 4 (each gross weight 500 g). The loading weight of the HU is therefore 2 kg. The tare weight of the HU is the packaging material weight (0.5 kg) plus the weight of the auxiliary packaging material (0.1 kg). The total weight of the HU is your loading weight, which is 2 kg, plus your tare weight of 0.6 kg, giving a total weight of 2.6 kg.
# Definition Specifies the total weight of the contents of the handling unit. The tare weight of the handling unit (that is, the packaging material) is not included. # Example Your packaging material has a gross weight of 0.5 kg and a 'maximum weight' of 2 kg. You pack product 'spark plugs' in the packaging material. The maximum number of spark plugs you can pack in the packaging material is 4 (each gross weight 500 g). The loading weight of the HU is therefore 2 kg. The tare weight of the HU is the packaging material weight (0.5 kg) plus the weight of the auxiliary packaging material (0.1 kg). The total weight of the HU is your loading weight, which is 2 kg, plus your tare weight of 0.6 kg, giving a total weight of 2.6 kg.
# Definition The tare weight of the handling unit corresponds to the gross weight of the packaging material of the packing level. It consists of the weight of the packaging material plus the weight of the auxiliary packaging material. # Example Your packaging material has a gross weight of 0.5 kg and a 'maximum weight' of 2 kg. You pack product 'spark plugs' in the packaging material. The maximum number of spark plugs you can pack in the packaging material is 4 (each gross weight 500 g). The loading weight of the HU is therefore 2 kg. The tare weight of the HU is the packaging material weight (0.5 kg) plus the weight of the auxiliary packaging material (0.1 kg). The total weight of the HU is your loading weight, which is 2 kg, plus your tare weight of 0.6 kg, giving a total weight of 2.6 kg.
# Definition Maximum allowed length. # Example
# Definition Maximum allowed width. # Example
# Definition Maximum allowed height. # Example
# Definition Unit in which the dimensions length, width, and height of a product or packaging of a product are measured.
# Use The weight unit is used, for example, for the maximum allowed weight and the weight of products in storage bins. # Dependencies
# Definition Specifies the total volume of the handling unit. Determination of the total volume depends on the packaging material. For open packaging materials, such as pallets, total volume is calculated from the **tare volume** of the packaging materials and the volume of the contents. For closed packaging materials, such as boxes with lids, the total volume is equal to the tare volume of the packaging. You can use the indicator **Packaging Material is Closed Packaging** to specify whether the packaging material in question is open or closed.
# Use The volume unit is used, for example, for the maximum allowed volume and the volume of products in storage bins. # Example
# Definition The storage bin (sometimes referred to as a "slot") is the smallest addressable unit in a warehouse. It identifies the exact location in the warehouse where goods can be stored. A storage bin can be further sub-divided into **storage bin sections**. Several different materials, or**quants**, can be stored in one bin at the same time.
-
